column4: clearze, yes, it worked for like months and months no problems until after the apt-get upgrade
this really sucks ass
what's the matter

I had ubuntu 6.06.1 installed as a lamp server.  no gui, then I decide for some dumb ass reason to upgrade to 6.1 edgy, and after I ran the apt-get update, and the apt-get upgrade, everything seemed to pull down and install, although I didn't get a "upgrade complete, reboot now" message, it just left me at the prompt.  so I rebooted, and now I can't connect to the network... My ethernet card is stuck with t
does dmesg recognize your eth0?

I don't know.  how do I check it to find it that line?   I get a red FAIL message now when it reboots but it goes by so fast, that I can't wwrite it down.  and I don't know what I"m looking for in dmesg
open a terminal.
I only have a terminal.  it has no gui on it
ok hang on
I typed that and it just went back to the prompt.  was it supposed to return something?
.. yes. Apparently your kernel doesn't see your ethernet controller.
you probably SHOULD boot off the livecd
